message.content:
cs.CR, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.NI 

This paper deals with a game-theoretical approach to finding optimal strategies in an intruder classification game. The game involves a strategic defender classifying an intruder as a spy or spammer based on the number of file server and mail server attacks observed during a fixed window. This falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also involves the use of game theory (cs.GT) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) to model the interaction between the players. The paper also involves simulations (cs.SI) to validate the theoretical results. Finally, the paper deals with network intrusion detection (cs.NI), which is closely related to computer security.
